name: gl-react-starter
description: Starter for scaffolding a new CSR-only React web app
author: GDP Labs

dependenciesComments.react-loadable: If we can't use React Suspense (because we need SSR), we need to use this react-lodable
dependenciesComments.react-router-dom: React de-facto library for routing (move between HTML pages)

devDependenciesComments.dotenv-webpack: Read .env file and put the variables into 'process.env'
devDependenciesComments.html-webpack-plugin: Generate HTML for us, completed with link to our bundles src
devDependenciesComments.jest-dom: Enhance jest so we have custom matchers that will make our test easier, e.g. toHaveAttribute, toBeDisabled
devDependenciesComments.react-testing-library: So we can test React component the way we will use it in development
devDependenciesComments.webpack: To build (bundle) our code. Similar to gradle, ant, and maven.
devDependenciesComments.webpack-cli: To run `webpack` command, we need a CLI and this webpack-cli is the obvious choice
devDependenciesComments.webpack-dev-server: To auto reload our web app whenever there's code changes. Also supports Hot Module Replacement (HMR) if enabled
devDependenciesComments.webpack-merge: For merging webpack config files. So we can have webpack.common.js and webpack.(dev|staging|prod).js
